metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Git Pull from GitHub
Change Platform:
Pull from Remote
In the last chapters, we made an account on GitHub and set up SSH.
content.html: In the last chapters, we made an account on GitHub and set up SSH.

content.text: Then we made some changes directly on GitHub.
content.html: Then we made some changes directly on GitHub.

content.text: Now we want to update our local repository with the changes from GitHub.
content.html: Now we want to update our local repository with the changes from GitHub.

content.text: Key Pull Commands
Fetch, Pull and Merge
When working as a team on a project, it is important that everyone stays up to date.
content.html: When working as a team on a project, it is important that everyone stays up to date.

content.text: Any time you start working on a project, you should get the most recent changes to your local copy.
content.html: Any time you start working on a project, you should get the most recent changes to your local copy.

content.text: With Git, you can do that with pull .
content.html: With Git, you can do that with pull.

content.text: pull is a combination of 2 different commands:
content.html: pull is a combination of 2 different commands:

content.text: Let's take a closer look into how fetch , merge , and pull works.
content.html: Let's take a closer look into how fetch, merge, and pull works.

content.text: Git Fetch
git fetch downloads new data from a remote repository, but does not change your working files or branches. It lets you see what others have pushed before you merge or pull.
content.html: git fetch downloads new data from a remote repository, but does not change your working files or branches. It lets you see what others have pushed before you merge or pull.

content.code:
git
fetch origin
remote: Enumerating objects: 5, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (5/5), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.
remote: Total 3 (delta 2), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (3/3), 733 bytes | 3.00 KiB/s, done.
From https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world
e0b6038..d29d69f  master     -> origin/master
content.code_html:
git fetch origin
remote: Enumerating objects: 5, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (5/5), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.
remote: Total 3 (delta 2), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (3/3), 733 bytes | 3.00 KiB/s, done.
From https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world
   e0b6038..d29d69f  master     -> origin/master

content.text: Now that we have the recent changes , we can check our status :
content.html: Now that we have the recent changes, we can check our status:

content.code:
git
status
On branch master
Your branch is behind 'origin/master' by 1 commit, and can be fast-forwarded.
(use "git pull" to update your local branch)

nothing to commit, working tree clean
content.code_html:
git status
On branch master
Your branch is behind 'origin/master' by 1 commit, and can be fast-forwarded.
  (use "git pull" to update your local branch)

nothing to commit, working tree clean

content.text: We are behind the origin/master by 1 commit . That should be the updated README.md , but lets double check by viewing the log :
content.html: We are behind the origin/master by 1 commit. That should be the updated README.md, but lets double check by viewing the log:

content.code:
git
log origin/master
commit d29d69ffe2ee9e6df6fa0d313bb0592b50f3b853 (origin/master)
Author: w3schools-test <77673807+w3schools-test@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 26 14:59:14 2021 +0100

Updated README.md with a line about GitHub

commit e0b6038b1345e50aca8885d8fd322fc0e5765c3b (HEAD -> master)
Merge: dfa79db 1f1584e
Author: w3schools-test

Date:   Fri Mar 26 12:42:56 2021 +0100

merged with hello-world-images after fixing conflicts

...
...
content.code_html:
git log origin/master
commit d29d69ffe2ee9e6df6fa0d313bb0592b50f3b853 (origin/master)
Author: w3schools-test <77673807+w3schools-test@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 26 14:59:14 2021 +0100

    Updated README.md with a line about GitHub

commit e0b6038b1345e50aca8885d8fd322fc0e5765c3b (HEAD -> master)
Merge: dfa79db 1f1584e
Author: w3schools-test 
Date:   Fri Mar 26 12:42:56 2021 +0100

    merged with hello-world-images after fixing conflicts

...
...

content.text: That looks as expected, but we can also verify by showing the differences between our local master and origin/master :
content.html: That looks as expected, but we can also verify by showing the differences between our local master and origin/master:

content.code:
git

diff
origin/master
diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index 23a0122..a980c39 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -2,6 +2,4 @@
Hello World repository for Git tutorial
This is an example repository for the Git tutoial on https://www.w3schools.com

-This repository is built step by step in the tutorial.
-
-It now includes steps for GitHub
+This repository is built step by step in the tutorial.
\ No newline at end of file
content.code_html:
git diff origin/master
diff --git a/README.md b/README.md
index 23a0122..a980c39 100644
--- a/README.md
+++ b/README.md
@@ -2,6 +2,4 @@
 Hello World repository for Git tutorial
 This is an example repository for the Git tutoial on https://www.w3schools.com

-This repository is built step by step in the tutorial.
-
-It now includes steps for GitHub
+This repository is built step by step in the tutorial.
\ No newline at end of file

content.text: That looks precisely as expected! Now we can safely merge .
content.html: That looks precisely as expected! Now we can safely merge.

content.text: Git Merge
merge combines the current branch, with a specified branch.
content.html: merge combines the current branch, with a specified branch.

content.text: We have confirmed that the updates are as expected, and we can merge our current branch ( master ) with origin/master :
content.html: We have confirmed that the updates are as expected, and we can merge our current branch (master) with origin/master:

content.code:
git
merge origin/master
Updating e0b6038..d29d69f
Fast-forward
README.md | 4 +++-
1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
content.code_html:
git merge origin/master
Updating e0b6038..d29d69f
Fast-forward
 README.md | 4 +++-
 1 file changed, 3 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

content.text: Check our status again to confirm we are up to date:
content.html: Check our status again to confirm we are up to date:

content.code:
git
status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean
content.code_html:
git status
On branch master
Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.

nothing to commit, working tree clean

content.text: There! Your local git is up to date!
content.html: There! Your local git is up to date!

content.text: Git Pull
But what if you just want to update your local repository, without going through all those steps?
content.html: But what if you just want to update your local repository, without going through all those steps?

content.text: pull is a combination of fetch and merge .
content.html: pull is a combination of fetch and merge.

content.text: It is used to pull all changes from a remote repository into the branch you are working on.
content.html: It is used to pull all changes from a remote repository into the branch you are working on.

content.text: Make another change to the Readme.md file on GitHub.
content.html: Make another change to the Readme.md file on GitHub.

content.text: Use pull to update our local Git:
content.html: Use pull to update our local Git:

content.code:
git
pull origin
remote: Enumerating objects: 5, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (5/5), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.
remote: Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (3/3), 794 bytes | 1024 bytes/s, done.
From https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world
a7cdd4b..ab6b4ed  master       -> origin/master
Updating a7cdd4b..ab6b4ed
Fast-forward
README.md | 2 ++
1 file changed, 2 insertions(+)
content.code_html:
git pull origin
remote: Enumerating objects: 5, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (5/5), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3/3), done.
remote: Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (3/3), 794 bytes | 1024 bytes/s, done.
From https://github.com/w3schools-test/hello-world
    a7cdd4b..ab6b4ed  master       -> origin/master
Updating a7cdd4b..ab6b4ed
Fast-forward
  README.md | 2 ++
  1 file changed, 2 insertions(+)

content.text: That is how you keep your local Git up to date from a remote repository. In the next chapter, we will look closer at how push works on GitHub.
content.html: That is how you keep your local Git up to date from a remote repository. In the next chapter, we will look closer at how push works on GitHub.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Which command downloads new data from a remote repository but does NOT change your working files or branches?
content.html: Which command downloads new data from a remote repository but does NOT change your working files or branches?

metadata.question: Which command downloads new data from a remote repository but does NOT change your working files or branches?

content.question: Which command downloads new data from a remote repository but does NOT change your working files or branches?
